label: Miro API
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the miro API.

tools.name: AddAppCardToBoard
tools.description:
Add an app card item to a specified board on Miro.

    Use this tool to add an app card item to a Miro board. Must have 'boards:write' scope permission. Appropriate for situations requiring interaction with Miro boards to add app-specific information cards.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: board_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the Miro board where the app card will be added.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"title":"Sample Card","content":"This is a sample app card for demonstration purposes."}

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: AddBoardFrame
tools.description:
Add a frame to a Miro board.

Use this tool to add a new frame item to a specified Miro board. It requires the 'boards:write' scope to operate and adheres to Level 2 rate limiting.

parameters.name: board_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the board where the frame will be created.

parameters.name: frame_fill_color
parameters.description: Specify the fill color for the frame using hex values. Supported colors include: `#f5f6f8`, `#d5f692`, `#d0e17a`, `#93d275`, `#67c6c0`, `#23bfe7`, `#a6ccf5`, `#7b92ff`, `#fff9b1`, `#f5d128`, `#ff9d48`, `#f16c7f`, `#ea94bb`, `#ffcee0`, `#b384bb`, `#000000`. The default is transparent (`#ffffffff`).

parameters.name: frame_format
parameters.description: Specify the format for the frame. Only 'custom' is supported.

parameters.name: frame_height_pixels
parameters.description: Specify the height of the frame in pixels on the Miro board.

parameters.name: frame_title
parameters.description: Title of the frame to appear at the top. It must be a string.

parameters.name: frame_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of frame to create. Only 'freeform' is supported at the moment.

parameters.name: frame_width_in_pixels
parameters.description: Specify the width of the frame in pixels.

parameters.name: position_y_coordinate
parameters.description: Y-axis coordinate for the frame's position on the board. Default is `0`. Center of the board has `x: 0` and `y: 0`.

parameters.name: reveal_frame_content
parameters.description: Set to true to reveal content inside the frame; false to hide it. Applicable for Enterprise plans only.

parameters.name: x_axis_position_on_board
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for placing the frame on the board. Default is 0, where the center is at x: 0.

tools.name: AddCardToMiroBoard

    Use this tool to create and add a new card item to a specified Miro board. This is useful for organizing tasks, notes, or ideas visually within a board. Ensure you have the required 'boards:write' scope for authorization.

    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: miro_board_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the Miro board where you want to add the card item.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

request_body.value: {"title":"New Task","content":"This is a description of the new task.","style":{"backgroundColor":"#FFCC00"}}

tools.name: AddDocumentToBoardByUrl
tools.description:
Add a document to a Miro board using its URL.

This tool adds a document as an item to a specified Miro board by providing the document's URL. It's useful for organizing resources in a collaborative board. Requires 'boards:write' scope and observes Level 2 rate limiting.

parameters.name: board_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the Miro board where the document will be added.

parameters.name: document_title
parameters.description: A short text header to identify the document added to the board.

parameters.name: document_url
parameters.description: The URL where the document is hosted. This URL is required to add the document to the Miro board.

parameters.name: item_height_in_pixels
parameters.description: Specifies the height of the item on the board in pixels.

parameters.name: item_width_in_pixels
parameters.description: Specify the width of the document item on the board in pixels.

parameters.name: parent_frame_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the parent frame for the document item on the board.

parameters.name: position_x_coordinate
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for placing the item on the board. Defaults to `0`. Center of board is `0`.

parameters.name: rotation_angle_degrees
parameters.description: Specify the rotation angle of the document item in degrees. Use positive values for clockwise rotation and negative for counterclockwise.

parameters.name: y_axis_coordinate_on_board
parameters.description: Y-axis coordinate for placing the document on the Miro board. Defaults to `0`, where `0` is the center of the board.

tools.name: AddEmbedItemToBoard
tools.description:
Add an embed item with external content to a Miro board.

Use this tool to add external content as an embed item to a specific board on Miro. Requires 'boards:write' scope and is subject to rate limiting.

parameters.name: board_identifier
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the board where you want to create the embed item.

parameters.name: content_display_mode
parameters.description: Specify how the embedded content is displayed on the board. Options are 'inline' for direct display and 'modal' for modal overlay.

parameters.name: content_url
parameters.description: A valid URL pointing to the content resource to embed in the board. Supports HTTP and HTTPS.

parameters.name: embed_item_width_pixels
parameters.description: Width of the embed item in pixels. Defines the size of the item on the board.

parameters.name: item_height
parameters.description: Specify the height of the embedded item, in pixels.

parameters.name: parent_frame_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the parent frame for the item on the Miro board.

parameters.name: preview_image_url
parameters.description: URL of the image used as the preview for the embedded item.

parameters.name: x_coordinate_on_board
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for the item's location on the board. Default is 0, with absolute positioning relative to the board center.

parameters.name: y_axis_coordinate_on_board
parameters.description: Y-axis coordinate for placing the item on the board. Default is 0, with (0, 0) as the board's center.

It's ideal for automating workflows or integrating with other tools that require visualization updates in Miro.

This operation also requires path parameters.

      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: board_identifier

parameters.name: request_body

tools.name: AddImageToMiroBoard
tools.description:
Add an image to a Miro board using a URL.

This tool is used to add an image to a specific Miro board by providing an image URL. It requires the 'boards:write' scope for authorization. Ideal for users who want to enhance their Miro boards with visual content by specifying image links.

parameters.name: board_unique_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the board where the image will be added.

parameters.name: image_height_pixels
parameters.description: Height of the image in pixels to be added to the Miro board.

parameters.name: image_title
parameters.description: A short text header to identify the image on the Miro board.

parameters.name: image_url
parameters.description: URL of the image to be added to the Miro board.

parameters.name: image_width_pixels
parameters.description: The width of the image in pixels to be added to the board.

parameters.name: parent_frame_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the parent frame where the image will be added. Use this to specify a frame within the board if needed.

parameters.name: rotation_angle_degrees
parameters.description: Rotation angle of the image, in degrees, relative to the board. Use positive for clockwise and negative for counterclockwise.

parameters.name: x_axis_coordinate
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for the image location on the Miro board. Center is at x: 0. Default is 0.

parameters.name: y_axis_coordinate
parameters.description: Y-axis coordinate of the item's location on the board. Default is 0, centered on the board.

tools.name: AddItemsToMiroBoard
tools.description:
Add up to 20 items to a Miro board in one transaction.

    Use this tool to add multiple items like shapes, cards, and sticky notes to a Miro board in one operation. The operation is transactional; if adding any item fails, no items will be added. Suitable for enhancing board content efficiently.

    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires path parameters.

      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required path parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: miro_board_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Miro board where items will be created.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: AddMindmapNode
tools.description:
Add a new mind map node to a Miro board.

This tool adds a new node to a mind map on a Miro board. It can create root or child nodes with specified x, y coordinates for positioning. Use it when you want to expand a mind map with additional nodes on a specified board.

parameters.name: board_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the board where the new mind map node will be created.

parameters.name: mindmap_node_content
parameters.description: The text content to display within the mind map node.

parameters.name: node_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of mind map node. Use 'text' as the current valid type.

parameters.name: node_width_pixels
parameters.description: Width of the mind map node in pixels. Specifies how wide the node will appear on the board.

parameters.name: parent_frame_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the parent node or frame for the mind map node.

parameters.name: x_coordinate
parameters.description: X-axis coordinate for node placement on the board. Defaults to `0`, placing the node at the center along the x-axis.

parameters.name: y_coordinate
parameters.description: Y-coordinate for item placement on the board. Defaults to 0 if not specified, placing it at the board's center.

tools.name: CopyMiroBoard

Create a copy of an existing Miro board.

    This tool creates a duplicate of an existing Miro board, allowing updates to the board's name, description, sharing policy, and permissions. It requires the 'boards:write' scope and complies with level 4 rate limiting.

    Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
    the stringified JSON input object for execution.

This operation also requires query parameters.

    Modes:
    - GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
      already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
      the schema.
    - EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
      JSON.
      Note: You must also provide the required query parameters when executing.

    If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.description: Unique identifier (ID) of the board that you want to copy.  Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'.

Initiates an export job for specified boards in an organization.

This tool creates an export job for one or more boards within Miro, available exclusively to Enterprise plan users with Company Admin roles and eDiscovery enabled. It's suitable for managing board exports, optimizing data handling within an organization.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for the export job, used to track the export process of boards in Miro.

parameters.name: organization_id

tools.name: CreateBoardSubscription
tools.description:
Subscribe to board update notifications via webhook.

Creates a webhook subscription to get notifications when an item on a board is updated. Suitable for monitoring changes on a board except for tags, connectors, and comments. Requires 'boards:read' scope.

parameters.name: board_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the board to associate with the webhook subscription.

parameters.name: webhook_callback_url
parameters.description: The HTTPS URL where Miro sends a webhook upon an event occurrence. This URL must be accessible by Miro to receive notifications.

parameters.name: webhook_status
parameters.description: Set the status of the webhook subscription. Use 'enabled' to receive notifications, 'disabled' to stop notifications, or 'lost_access' if access to the board is lost.

tools.name: FetchBoardContentChanges
tools.description:
Fetches content changes for board items in your organization.

Use this tool to retrieve content changes made to board items in your organization, including updates, creations, and deletions by users. You can filter the results by time period, board IDs, and user emails, and paginate the data for processing. Note: This tool is for Enterprise plan users and requires Company Admin role.

parameters.name: end_modification_datetime
parameters.description: Specify the end date and time for filtering content logs based on when a board item was last modified. Use UTC format adhering to ISO 8601 with a trailing Z offset.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: A string representing the unique identifier of the organization required for fetching board content changes.

parameters.name: start_date_time
parameters.description: Specify the start date and time for filtering content logs, in UTC format (ISO 8601 with trailing Z).

parameters.name: board_ids
parameters.description: List of board IDs for retrieving content logs. Provide as an array of strings.

parameters.name: max_results_per_call
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per call. If exceeded, a cursor is provided for pagination.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination to fetch the next set of results. Use the cursor value from the previous response to continue retrieving paginated results.

parameters.name: sort_order_by_date
parameters.description: Specify 'asc' for ascending or 'desc' for descending sort order based on modified date.

parameters.name: user_email_filter
parameters.description: Filter content logs based on the list of emails of users who created, modified, or deleted board items.

summary:
Arcade Toolkit integrates with the Miro API, allowing developers to enhance collaborative functionalities within Miro boards. It empowers applications to add, update, or delete board items effectively while maintaining user engagement. 

**Capabilities** 
- Automated addition and management of various items on Miro boards. 
- Streamlined updates to existing board elements, such as shapes and text items. 
- Efficient retrieval of board details and user activities for oversight. 
- Integration with enterprise project management features. 

**OAuth** 
- Provider: Miro 
- Scopes: boards:write, projects:write 

**Secrets** 
- No secret types or names required for this toolkit.
